p: A third gene, ORF DIV1_142L, encodes a von Willebrand factor A (vWFA) domain-containing protein with a VIT domain and a vWFA domain, and is probably involved in proteinâ€“protein interaction, in protease inhibition, and in extracellular matrix binding and/or stability ( Whittaker and Hynes 2002). Proteins containing the vWA domain are present in eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea, phages, and viruses such as NCLDVs ( Whittaker and Hynes 2002; Schroeder et al. 2009 ). This protein is orthologous and highly similar to an uncharacterized protein of D. magna (KZS17173.1, e-value 2e -106, ident. 32%) and a hypothetical protein of D. pulex (EFX90299.1, e-value 9e -99, ident. 30%), but no ortholog is found in other Iridoviridae, suggesting that DIV-1 might have acquired this protein by HGT from D. magna.
